parameters.definition: Minimum number of cars to be delivered
Pollution factor constraint for large planes

description: A car manufacturer ships their cars on large and small planes. A large plane can carry \param{LargePlaneCapacity} cars while a small plane can carry \param{SmallPlaneCapacity} cars. Since large planes cause more pollution, the number of large planes must be less than \param{PollutionRatio} times the number of small planes. If the manufacturer wants to deliver at least \param{MinimumCarsDelivered} cars, find the minimum number of planes that can be used.
